meanings.definition: The round, white part of the eye that allows you to see.
meanings.sent1: Her eyeballs were blue and sparkly.
meanings.sent2: He accidentally got soap in his eyeballs while washing his face.
meanings.sent3: The eyeballs on the Halloween decorations seemed to follow you around the room.
meanings.sent4: In the dark forest, the glowing eyes of animals looked like eerie eyeballs.
meanings.sent5: The artist painted the portrait with intricate details, including the subject's bright eyeballs.

meanings.definition: To look at closely or with interest.
meanings.sent1: She eyeballs the menu at the restaurant before deciding what to order.
meanings.sent2: The detective eyeballs the suspect, trying to read his expression.
meanings.sent3: The cat eyeballs the toy mouse, preparing to pounce on it.
meanings.sent4: The teacher eyeballs the students during the test to prevent cheating.
meanings.sent5: As the magician performed his tricks, the audience eagerly eyeballed his every move.
